intro: Phacelia curvipes var. yosemitana, commonly known as Yosemita phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountains of California. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, glandular hairs on its stems and leaves. This variant is distinguished by its slightly curved petals and is often found in the Yosemite National Park area.
